instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V only
threads.message:
My reference only: REF1132

No history on board other than no power when it came in.
5v on meter, no amps drawing.
I replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> twice, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is flucuating between 1.2v, drops to .933v, then back to 1.2v, and it repeats this consistently.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 5V only
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and all big coils; don't forget L9060.
Compare readings with good board, or refference table.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://openboarddata.org/?a=showboardsolutions&bpath=laptops/apple/<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>[/URL]
